Summary: blurry white circle atop a bowed triangle fading
divs: sighting details7 friends and i stopped our night game of night football because one had pointed out an abnormally wide plane-like movement of low lights in the sky. horizontally the light colors were red, blue, red, spread out wider than ever seen before, but clearly all apart of the same object. it was flying east directly above us at the speed of a regular plane. some of us got excited, but others brushed it aside as just some kind of air plane. a minute later when the object is directly above us, it vanishes, only to reappear a second later in a different spot along it's path as a huge, filled in, white, triangle. it was an awkward shaped triangle, bowing downward at the bottom and inward at the sides. it was all glowing in a blurry way. but it was the circle at the top point of the triangle that was the main focal point. it was like a huge, bright ball of cotton. we all stood in the street, staring up, amazed. all was silent. the entire figure became more and more blurry for the 10 seconds that we saw it. then it disappeared into the darkening night. it was just to the right of (what is believed to be) the north star. and further left of that was the pinkish glow\aurora from new york city.(40 miles east of sparta). 3 friends pulled out their phones to take pictures of the huge phenomenon in the sky, but it wouldn't come up on anyones phone. we then all looked at each other establishing that we all indeed saw the same thing. as a bunch off teenage kids, we were both nervous and scared. it made my nerves tingle and my eyes watery when i thought about it.
